Message.Issue: Implement IDisposable on 'ClienteController' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'ConnectionManager'. If 'ClienteController' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Implement IDisposable on 'LoginController' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'ConnectionManager'. If 'LoginController' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Implement IDisposable on 'PesquisaProdutoController' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'ConnectionManager'.

Implement IDisposable on 'VendaController' because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: 'ConnectionManager'. If 'VendaController' has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on 'ConnectionManager' or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.
Modify 'ConnectionManager.Dispose()' so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

Rule.Name: Implement IDisposable correctly
Rule.Description: All IDisposable types should implement the Dispose pattern correctly.
Rule.Resolution: Modify {0} so that it calls Dispose(true), then calls GC.SuppressFinalize on the current object instance ('this' or 'Me' in Visual Basic), and then returns.

Provide an overridable implementation of Dispose(bool) on {0} or mark the type as sealed. A call to Dispose(false) should only clean up native resources. A call to Dispose(true) should clean up both managed and native resources.

Rule.Name: Types that own disposable fields should be disposable
Rule.Description: Types that declare disposable members should also implement IDisposable. If the type does not own any unmanaged resources, do not implement a finalizer on it.
Rule.Resolution: Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}. If {0} has previously shipped, adding new members that implement IDisposable to this type is considered a breaking change to existing consumers.
Implement IDisposable on {0} because it creates members of the following IDisposable types: {1}.
